The directions to the cabin were clear and it was very easy to find. Iâ€™m telling you, the pictures donâ€™t do this place justice. Yes itâ€™s in the backyard of a main house but itâ€™s not close to the house at all! Itâ€™s nestled back in the trees with a bonfire area (which is shared with the main house guests) and very peaceful. If you didnâ€™t read, there is a waterfall in the very back of the property. We loved it back there. The cabin itâ€™s self is very clean and I loved the bathroom. The bed is definitely big enough for 2 people. Thereâ€™s a microwave & mini fridge to store snacks. We didnâ€™t need any more space than what the tiny cabin has so it was perfect. Itâ€™s a very easy drive into town and Ruby Falls Rock City were only about a 10 minute drive. All in all it was a 10/10 definitely recommend trip. I would give them a thousand stars if I could. Thank yaâ€™ll!

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Staying here was a splurge for me, but it was wonderful. The space was so beautiful itself, and its location even more so. The hosts gave the perfect of information about staying in a somewhat hidden-away place, sending a message before arrival and having a book in the room with everything needed, including how to use the coffee machine and find the trailheads with a hand-drawn map. A lot of care could be felt! I walked and used the bus to access the cabin and surroundings, and while the walk is a bit steep and tiring with a bag, it's totally doable and well worth it! (The 15 bus is free, too, which I didn't realize until arrival.) There is so much walking/hiking you can do, and it's gorgeous. There was a big storm one of the nights, and this meant seeing the waterfall with many different kinds of flows. You will always hear it rushing, and can see it from the front door. A really spectacular place to have access to - I only wish I could have stayed longer--the bed is SO comfortable!

name: Joe
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
March 2024
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Pictures can't even begin to do justice to the beauty of this spot. This is a unicorn property even among all the other dream homes on the mountain. You can hear the waterfall 24/7, which brings serenity to each moment. The terraced yard is a great place to just take in nature with views everywhere you look. The trailhead up Lookout Mountain is literally steps from the cabin, yet still miraculously private. The cabin is rustic and cool, with everything a couple could need for a peaceful respite. We had a wonderful fire in the wood stove while streaming NHL games directly to the roku TV from my phone with ease. It's just 2 miles to everything St. Elmo's has to offer, but feels truly hidden away in the woods. Joanna is a very friendly and pleasant host, and you can easily see her pride of ownership in all the details. My only regret is that we only had 2 nights to escape reality. I hope we have an opportunity to return soon.

name: Nolan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I really enjoyed my stay in this cozy cabin. The environment was relaxing and inviting. I had everything I needed to get through the day and they even had included popcorn, coffee maker, and an induction cooktop which I used several times. The scenery was excellent, you can hear the creek flowing from inside the cabin.
The biggest con is the hot water runs out very quickly, I was out of hot water in less than 10 minutes in the shower. I highly recommend to the owners to either upgrade to an instant hot water heater or swap out the shower head for something more water efficient. If there were to be 2 guest's staying in the cabin, they would definitely have to shower a good amount of time apart.
I didn't care for the coffee they had on hand, but it was nice that it was there. I ended up bringing my own grounds because their's was too acidic.
Overall, I highly recommend this cabin especially for the price. Very affordable compared to other options in the area.

(Notice anyone with mobility issues:
The ascent/descent path (& stairs) from parking to cabin door are a little steep, made of stepping stones, and about 75 feet away).
Hosts were quick to reply. Will stay again, SOON!.

This place is perfect and I mean perfect.
The details and instructions were very specific and I felt safe here. It felt so nice to be so close to private nature and public fun like vintage stores and ice cream. I woke up in nature and took a hike without ever getting into my car!
It was such a treat to be able to enjoy this busy city and private nature in such a safe location. Even during the day, I found myself getting excited to come back to this Airbnb! I didn't have a busy itinerary, so I ended up spending a lot of time drinking lovely tea (water kettle and tea provided of course - Joanna thinks of everything!) sitting on the porch, and watching the water and trees move in a breathtaking backyard.
This place is perfect for any trip. Do you need to get downtown quick? Dude, you're basically already in downtown. Wanna be in nature? Dude, you're in it. The best experience.
I will visit again. Thank you

review_text: Joannaâ€™s little cabin sits in the back of another air bnb property nestled between a rocky hillside and a very enjoyable waterfall. We were disappointed that we didnâ€™t have time on this trip to take the recommended hike up to the top of the waterfall but the soothing sounds carried throughout the cabin and made for a nice location to take photos together. The nearby St Elmo historic district provided quick access to stores, gas, restaurants, and tourist attractions. The bedding, bathroom, kitchenette, etc were more than adequate. As expected you will be dealing with bugs because of the location, though we were surprised to find a small scorpion in the kitchen sink. Turns out these are common in TN so be aware, our piece of advice regarding the bugs is to leave the outside lights off at night, otherwise they swarm the door and easily get inside. We enjoyed our stay so much, and ran into so many things we needed more time to do, we hope we can visit again in the future.

review_text:
What a roomy and well appointed airbnb! Parking was a breeze and was just steps away from the front door. Upon entering, an inviting sitting room awaits followed by a dining area, sparkling clean kitchen and cozy living room with a tv. The bedrooms and bathrooms are located to the right of the main rooms and each bedroom has a tv. An extra closet in the rooms with the twin beds has luggage stands available for use. There were k cups, creamer and sugar in the kitchen which was such a thoughtful touch! We loved the two decks where you could enjoy your cup of coffee and listen to the cascading creek below.
Located in the St Elmo neighborhood of Chattanooga, this was a fantastic spot for exploring Lookout Mountain, the Chickamauga Battlefield and the downtown river district. I'd definitely stay here again!

name: Angela
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
January 2018
,
Â·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
Thank you so much for hosting us. This home was perfect for our needs. We loved the natural lighting within the home, the spacious and private backyard with large waterfall and creek and the access to trails just off the property. Joanna and Pete were quick to answer our text messages when we sent them a question. We appreciate the allowance of well behaved dogs. This was our first time traveling with our dogs and we were so happy to find such a nice place to stay and be able to bring them with us. The home was tidy and the St. Elmo location was perfect for us. It's not too far of a drive to downtown Chattanooga or the coffee, ice cream and restaurants in historic St. Elmo.
We recommend making the time to eat at Community Pie pizzeria, the Cupcake Kitchen for incredible desserts, the Flying Squirrel for excellent cocktails, large beer selection and food (18+ establishment) and St. John's for fine dining. We also loved Clumpies Ice Cream at Coolridge park, the Hot Chocolatier (across from the Choo Choo downtown), Main Street Meats and Neidlov's bakery. There is so much great food in Chattanooga! There is also a Clumpies in St. Elmo but we did not visit that location.
One of our best memories was going to Rock City on a weekday. This home is located very close to Rock City so make sure that you make plans to visit this iconic site. We virtually had the park to ourselves as it was very cold and thick with fog. While you cannot "See Seven States" (a look out point that the park is known for) in the fog, the thick fog lent the most magical atmosphere to the large waterfall, incredible rock formations and caverns that we will not soon forget.
This rental was fantastic and affordable and we would very much like to stay here again in the future. Recommended!

We came to Chattanooga for the UT Chattanooga graduation. Madison was very friendly and quick to respond. Unfortunately we had been hit in a pretty bad car wreck that had totaled our family vehicle a few days before we were to go and I had messaged her to see if we could cancel for a full refund despite it being past the time to receive that. She was not willing to accommodate which was unfortunate. We had to do some scrambling to borrow a vehicle that could fit our family. We found one and made the trip there but had to find someone to take care of our two dogs which we'd planned to bring.
Madison's house is in a cute neighborhood tucked away from the busyness. The house is really cute on the inside and accurately reflects how the photos look online. The location is great and close access to several stores as well as the university.

And then, after I entered the house at such an hour, I didn't know which way to the bedroom. (even though it was well lit) Catlyn to the rescue! She knew "oh gah..here's another one..let me help this dodo to their room." *facepalm*
Catlyn is precious. Karen is remarkable in her communication and detail and went above and beyond for me even after my stay. I'd stay here time and time again!

review_text:
Karen's beautiful 1930's home is a true gem. From the moment you step inside, you can feel the charm and character of this well preserved piece of history. The house is in great condition, with beautifully maintained original features like hardwood floors, crown molding, and period fixtures.
The room I stayed in was exceptionally comfortable, with a cozy bed, plush linens, and plenty of pillows. The room was well appointed with all the amenities you would need for a comfortable stay, including ample closet space, and a private bathroom. The room was also tastefully decorated and beautiful view of the neighborhood.
One of the best things about staying in Karen's home is its convenient location. Despite being located in a historic neighborhood, the house is only 10 minutes from the commercial heart of downtown Chattanooga. This makes it the perfect home base for exploring all that the city has to of

Exactly the stay we were wanting. The place was so safe, clean, quiet, and welcoming. It had everything we needed. However, the fiancÃ© said she needed a bedroom mirror for getting ready - a standing mirror maybe and more couch pillows too, ha!
Other than that, it was perfect. The price per night was way affordable and the area was close to everything we wanted to visit (Incline, Rock City, and Ruby Falls).
Greg provided good restaurant recommendations and our hands down favorite is Milk and Honey for breakfast. The Korean Place, Volcano, was very good too for dinner. A cool place to eat lunch was the Purple Daisy.
The attractions were all close by as the apartment is in the Saint Elmo area with its own restaurants that were good too. The parking spot is right at the apartment. We walked to the shops, Incline, 1865, and the Purple Daisey.
We will return as we really like Chattanooga and are coming back for River Bend.
Greg, thanks so much. Weâ€™ll see you soon.

It was a tough week before we left to go on vacation - a trip to the ER after a horrible bout of stomach flu led to a serious depletion of fluids and electrolytes. Until Sunday morning, we were undecided as to whether to go or, stay home. We decided to take a chance, thinking the worst that could happen is that we would just have to hang out at Gregâ€™s place the entire time. That would not have been at all difficult to do as we had everything we needed to just chill and watch movies, read or, just enjoy the peace and quiet. Greg gave great directions and instructions on getting into his place. It was absolutely wonderful with all of the comforts of home - a comfy bed, great shower and books to read.
Fortunately, the next day, I felt much better! We took it easy, rode the incline, drove up Lookout Mountain and had an early evening. Gregâ€™s recommendations for food were great - loved the Purple Daisy and Tonyâ€™s Pasta Shop. We had a great stay and would definitely stay here again! Thanks!

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Absolutely a hidden gem!
The place itself was clean and perfect for 2! It included a kitchen with a fridge, dishwasher, oven, convection oven, coffee pot, and microwave. Cute sitting area for watching tv and a large, extremely comfortable bed, best sleep Iâ€™ve had in a while!
The location: where do I begin! The house was nestled right on the base of the mountain. A short walk to downtown where there was a few restaurants, ice cream shops, coffee shops, and even some art shops. You could view the Incline from the window and a short walk would get you to the main station! A 2-3 minute drive brought you to a grocery store and a 5 minute drive took you to more restaurants as well as a Publix.
Entertainment: this was the PERFECT spot for us! A short drive up the mountain lead us to Ruby Falls and Rock City. Further up the mountain was a civil war battleground, Covenant College, and some hiking trails.We also took a day trip and went downtown to the Aquarium and the Chattanooga Zoo. This is the perfect getaway for a couple or small family as all the entertainment was within 20 minutes.
The hosts: AMAZING! The host met us upon arrival and gave us a walkthrough of the space as well as gave us several places to eat and some must-sees. They even went above and beyond when we went for a walk with some unexpected rain, and they let us borrow their umbrella!
This was the best getaway experience Iâ€™ve ever had and highly recommend this rental!

The location is an up and coming area with a hip, cool vibe..., but be advised, the neighborhood has a mix of newer homes, run down homes, and some remodeled homes. It is the older, historic section of Chattanooga. Not trying to be negative, because we enjoyed our stay, but want others to know what to expect.

There were a couple of unexpected noise issues: the building is close to a fire station, and there was a constant drone from a nearby ventilation system. However, Curt thoughtfully provided a white noise machine, which helped a lot.
One other surprise was a strong manure/agricultural smell outside, which discouraged us from exploring the neighborhood as we had planned. We only stayed for one night, so this could be an unusual occurrence.
Overall, the loft itself was lovely and well-appointed, and Curtâ€™s hospitality made our stay enjoyable despite the minor inconveniences.

Many great restaurants/cafes within walking distance and the hosts provided a very helpful local handmade guidebook with so many suggestions for fun things to do! review_text:
The condo was immaculate, the decor was gorgeous, and the beds and sofa were extremely comfortable. There were muffins and a bottle of wine waiting upon our arrival. If you have fantasized about living in a hip downtown loft, this is your place. Personally I loved it, but my business partner was not sold for the following reasons.
The directions from Alex and Curt were very good, but without reading them in detail you will never find this place. And because the condo is located over a bar, it was a bit disconcerting for her to arrive alone in the dark and have to walk behind the unit to access the elevator entrance to take up the suitcases. Finally, the unit is across from a fire station and near train tracks. There was loud music playing after midnight on the patio next door both nights, and between that and the trains and the fire trucks it was too noisy for any light sleeper.
I sleep like the dead with my headphones, like the city, so I would definitely come back!

name: Anna

Rating, 5 stars
,

,

Stayed with kids
review_text:
Donâ€™t look for a Chattanooga spot for another second - this is, by far, one of the best spots weâ€™ve stayed in!
Pros:
-GORGEOUS and large apartment! So beautifully decorated, awesome industrial vibe but still super cozy, fantastic location and packed with amenities!
-Super clean - and weâ€™re fanatic about this.
-Fantastic welcome book packed with great advice about the apartment, dining and things to do.
-Great communication from super welcoming hosts!
Location:
-We walked for 2-3m and ate dinner at State of Confusion (try the steak chimi - SO good). Tons of other great restaurants on the street. Loved how walkable this was. -Great parking right outside.
Amenities:
-Living/Dining: our favorite spot with too much to count, but our favorites were the games, books, and coziest fireplace/couch/blankets. Great viewing options of smart TV with various apps available.
-Kitchen is super well stocked with all the tools, dishes, glasses, spices and a water pitcher. Great variety of coffee pods. Super cute welcome note & amenity upon arrival.
-Bathrooms all have super plush towels, pump hand soaps and wall pumps for shampoo/conditioner/body wash. Showers were very good also. And the toilet paper was A+ â€” you know this is a big deal! ;)
-Bedrooms all have the heavenliest mattresses (and we are super picky), noise machines, ear plugs, luggage rack, and ample storage. You can also find a box fan in the second bedroom.
Tips:
-Bring a laundry bag for things with strings or delicates so they donâ€™t get tangled.
-Lots of stairs so note the use of the service elevator in the back of the building if accessibility is a factor.
-Bring creamer and sugar for your coffee!
-Donâ€™t sleep on finding the little hidden faux woodland creatures in the nooks of the brick. My kids LOVED spotting them all!
Overall, fantastic, A++ stay! Thanks, Alex & Curt!

Our family really enjoyed staying in this cute spot ... great location, super comfortable den area with seating enough for everyone, well stocked kitchen, stylish rooms, luxurious bedding, and fun architectural features. Hosts were responsive and kind. Welcomed with homemade cookies (big hit with the teens) and a bottle of wine (big hit with me!). Hosts have created a book with detailed information about all that Chattanooga has to offer. One of our best Airbnb experiences to date. We highly recommend!

review_text: â€œDeâ€™Vine Home - five minutes from downtownâ€ is the heading for this property, which greatly appealed to me, and sold me. We soon realized after arriving this home was located 15-20 minutes from downtown and also situated on the corner of a busy traffic street in a rough neighborhood. The house itself is old but very neat and clean. It looks to have been updated in the past 10 years. Throughout the night you can hear loud boom boxes from passing cars on the busy street. Also the rusted grill in the backyard has no accompanying utensils, and is basically unusable. Also, the pillows offered are very hard. We want people to know the heading for this property is very misleading. Five minutes from downtown is false advertising. Also, in the instructions we were given Anitaâ€™s name and telephone number to contact prior to arriving and during our stay. In our experience Anita does not respond to voicemail or text. We could only get a response from her through Airbnb.
